titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album Orientreise 1898 AD.MC.062
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman, Jonathan Burr and Emily Broad for Akkasah: Photography Archive at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-25 22:13:22 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Orientreise 1898

physdesc.extent: Folio (37x28 cm). 24 leaves. With 110 gelatin silver photographs numbered mounted (recto & verso) in twenty-four leaves. Photos mostly ca. 10x15 cm (4x6 in) with twenty-four smaller images. [With] two manuscript lists describing the photos. Original red gilt lined half morocco album with red cloth boards with stamped gilt title on front cover. Mounts a little waved, extremities very mildly rubbed, but overall a very good album of strong photographs.

did.abstract: An album of photographs that document a voyage made in 1898. The majority of the photos show Egypt, Palestine, Lebanon, Syria and Turkey. The photographs show coastal and port scenes, city and street views, historical sights, images of the travellers and onboard life. Of note is an accompanying handwritten content list and note book (in German).

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Album containing 110 gelatin silver photographs which document a voyage made in February and March 1898, which took the photographer from Genoa to Monaco, Tunis, Alexandria, Cairo (and environs), Jerusalem, Dead Sea, Beirut, Damascus and then the return voyage via Constantinople, Athens, Crete, Palermo, Naples and finally the Genoa suburb of La Mortola. The photographs show coastal and port scenes, city and street views, historical sights, images of the travellers and onboard life. The majority of the photos show Egypt, Palestine, Lebanon, Syria and Turkey.
Photos mostly ca. 10x15 cm (4x6 in) with twenty-four smaller images. Accompanying handwritten content list and note book in German.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact Akkasah Photography Archive, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the previous owner were transferred to Akkasah Photography Archive on 14th August 2018. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah Photography Archive, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from The Wayfarer's Bookshop in January 2017, associated accession identifier 2017_023.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: ADMC062 Akkasah: Photography Archive, New York University Abu Dhabi. For more information visit https://akkasah.org/en/page/frontpage/faq

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in a new acid-free box. They have been digitized and cataloged at the item (page) level.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The creator/s of the album are unknown. They/their fellow travellers are pictured in refs AD_MC_062_ref16, ref22, ref23, ref26, ref41, ref46-ref48, ref50 and ref52.

did.unittitle: The front cover of the album 'Orientreise, 1898'.
The inside front cover of the album 'Orientreise, 1898'.
A blank page in the album 'Orientreise, 1898'.
A blank page in the album 'Orientreise, 1898'.
Two views of the Port of Genoa and the surrounding city.
Top: a view of the Rock of Monaco. Bottom: French warships sailing near a French port.
Top: men, women, and children outside the bazaar in Tunis. Bottom: A view of men, women, and children at a marketplace in Bab Souika, Tunis.
Top: a man next to two camels. Bottom: a view of the Parc du Belvédère in Tunis, with a mountain in the background.
Top: a group of ships arriving to a port in Alexandria, with the guide book in the foreground. Bottom: a group of banana boats on the Nile River in El Mahmoudia, Alexandria.
Top: an empty field next to a river with mountains in the background in Cairo. Bottom: boats docked in a canal on the Nile River.

Top: people in the streets beside the Mausoleum of Mamluk Amir Janibak al-Ashrafi (foreground) and Funerary Khanqah of Mamluk Sultan Faraj ibn Barquq (background). Bottom: A shop with a printing press, near Bab Zuweila.
Top: a farm with buildings on the horizon in Boulaq, Cairo. Bottom: a caravan.
Top: a caravan on the Avenue of the Pyramids in Giza. Bottom: a canal and and fig trees.
Top: buildings on the bank of Roda Island, Cairo. Bottom: a farm in Heliopolis with donkeys and machinery.
Top: A group portrait of several men and a woman in front of the Cheops Pyramid and the Sphinx. Bottom: the Sphinx and the Great Pyramids.
Top: a group of people climbing the Great Pyramids. Bottom: the town of Bedrachein on the Nile River.
Top: a palm tree forest in Memphis. Bottom: a group of men traveling to the Pyramid of Djoser.
Top: a crowd of people and donkeys in Saqqara. Bottom: a street scene beside Jaffa Gate including a photography studio and barbers.
Top: the Tower of David (Jerusalem Citadel). Bottom: a view of the Mount of Olives, Jerusalem.
Top: a crowd of men and women at the base of the Mount of Olives, Jerusalem. Bottom: a view of Siloam.
Top: a group portrait of two men and a woman posed outside a tent in Jericho. Bottom: a man posed by the cost of the Dead Sea.
Top: A group portrait of men and women on the coast of the Dead Sea. Bottom: a view of the River Jordan with a woman in the foreground.
Top: a view of tents on the way from Jerusalem to Jericho. Bottom: a view of Beirut.
Top: a boat sailing near the coast of Beirut. Bottom: a road in Mount Sannine near terraced farms.
Top: a group of people congregated at the base of a terraced mountain town, Muallaqa (Zahle), on the way from Beirut to Damascus. Bottom: a train track in the Anti-Lebanon Mountains.
Top: a man riding a camel in Muallaqa (Zahle). Bottom: a group of men gathered outside a building.
Top: a man in the courtyard of the Umayyad Mosque. Bottom: an aerial view of Damascus.
Top: an aerial view of the Umayyad Mosque. Bottom: a fountain in the courtyard of a Christian house.
Top: a bridge on the Barada River with the Tekkiye Mosque and Mount Hermon in the background. Bottom: a rooftop view of a city and a two-story arched dome.
Top: a vignetted street scene featuring a mosque. Bottom: the Bosporus Sea with Uskudar, Istanbul in the background.
Top: ships sailing off the coast of Istanbul. Bottom: a view of the Rumelihisarı.
Top: a view of the Rumelihisarı and adjacent buildings. Bottom: a ship sailing off the coast of Istanbul and the Dolmabahçe Palace (linked ref32).
Top: a view of Istanbul's coast including the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace taken from the Bosphorus. Bottom: a cargo ship from Hamburg docked at a harbor in Piran.
Top: a ship sailing out of a port. Bottom: a ship "Auguste-Victoria" sailing adjacent to smaller rowboats.
Top: a view of the Acropolis. Bottom: ruins of an ancient temple at the Acropolis.
Top: view of Athens taken from the Acropolis. Bottom: a view of the Erechtheion.
Top: a view of a Chania, Crete with mountains in the background. Bottom: the Port of Chania, Crete.
Top: a boat docked at the Port of Chania, Crete. Bottom: passengers on the deck of the "Auguste-Victoria" ship.
Two views of ships. Top: a ship in the south bay of Sardinia. Bottom: ships in a port in the moonlight.
Top: a view of Turkish forts. Bottom: a woman on a the deck of the "Auguste-Victoria" ship.
Top: a view of three boats off the coast of Palermo near Mount Pellegrino. Bottom: a body of water with ships and a city in the distance, taken from the "Auguste-Victoria" ship.
Two views of the Villa Hanbury in La Mortola, Genoa.
Top: a view of the Villa Hanbury in La Mortola. Bottom: a fountain in La Mortola (linked ref43).
Top: foliage by a road. Bottom: a view of the mountainous coast in La Mortola.

From the top right counter-clockwise: a group portrait of several men at the Palace of the Bey (Dar el Bey), Tunis; the courtyard at the Palace of the Bey (Dar el Bey), Tunis; a group of men at the foot of the Sphinx; a view of the Great Pyramid and the Sphinx.
From the top right counter-clockwise: two portraits of a crowd posed in front of the Sphinx and the Great Pyramid, a cemetery in Cairo, and the Mena House Hotel near the Great Pyramids.
From the top right counter-clockwise: men on the road in Saqqara, a group of men riding donkeys in Memphis, the village of Bedrechem, and a village in Saqqara.
From the top right counter-clockwise: the facade of the Ayyubid Omar Mosque, Jerusalem; a caravan's arrival in Bethlehem; the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus; and a Bedouin hotel in Jericho.
From the top right counter-clockwise: two views of a lunch spot on the way from Jerusalem to Jericho, the Acropolis, and ruins in Baalbek.
From the top right counter-clockwise: a view of the Rumelihisarı; the Port of Chania, Crete; a view of the Villa Durazzo-Pallavicini in Genoa; and a view of the deck on the Auguste in Victoria.
Top: a ship sailing. Bottom: a group portrait of two men and two women taken on a the "Auguste-Victoria."
Top: a view of Mount Lycabettus, Athens. Bottom: a vingetted view of buildings and a mosque taken from the street.
